page.title: 06ECOLOGY
page.content: Although much of the area is intensively managed grassland, there is a number of small copses, desiduous and coniferous, and in the west is Beacon Fell Country Park.Pastures are bounded by hedges (hawthorn, beech, holly, sycamore, blackthorn, alder, chestnut, rowan, hazel, dog rose, honeysuckle, blackberry) or sandstone walls. There are several streams, including a tributary of the River Brock, the minor River Loud, two reservoirs at Barns Fold and countless small ponds. Wild life includes coot, crested duck, pochard duck, mallard, heron, Canada geese, sandpiper, curlew, wood pigeon, woodcock,pheasant, kestrel, partridge,kingfisher,sparrow hawk the rare grasshopper warbler, rabbits, hares, foxes, stoats, weasels, moles hedgehogs, squirrels, shrews,roe deer.
